remove.notFound: Sorry, couldn't find the birthday to remove.

add.missingData: Please provide the name and birthday in the following format: `/add Sam, 1984-03-30`
add.errorParsingDate: The date format is invalid. Please use YYYY-MM-DD, for example: `/add Saul, 1989-01-31`

add.alreadyExists: A birthday person with that name already exists.
add.askForData: Please reply with the name and birthdate (year-month-day) of the birthday to add (e.g. `Sam, 1986-06-11`):

modify.errorInvalidDate: Sorry, the new birthdate provided is not valid.

all.intro: Open the Calendar view, where you can see all the birthdays from the chat groups you're on, by clicking the button below:

errors.empty: No birthdays added yet. Type /help if you're stuck!

errors.needGroup: This command only works in a group.
errors.needPvt: This command only works in a private (DM) chat with me.

Group id is missing - did you mean to run this command on a group chat?
Otherwise supply the id as the last comma separated param (e.g., `/add John, 1998-04-12, -123456` or `/list -123456`)

welcomeGroup:
ğŸ‘‹ *{{chatTitle}}*!
Hi there! I'm a bot ğŸ¤– here to help you remember everyone's birthdays. ğŸ‰
 To learn more about what I can do, just type /help. Start by adding the first birthday by using the add command with the name and date separated by a comma (e.g., `/add David, 1984-07-01`)
startMessage:
ğŸ‚ *Welcome to the Birthday bot!* ğŸ‚
I live to help you remember all your friends birthdays. ğŸ¤–

You can add me to a Group Chat so that everyone in the group can add birthdays collaboratively, or save your important dates privately by using DMs.

Start by adding birthdays using the /add command and I will send congratulatory messages when birthdays are due! ğŸ‰.

Check what other commands are available by typing /help and please give us your feedback using the /feedback command. Enjoy! ğŸˆ
startMessageOnDm:
ğŸ‚ *Welcome to the Birthday bot!* ğŸ‚
I live to help you remember all your friends birthdays. ğŸ¤–

You can add me to a Group Chat so that everyone in the group can add birthdays collaboratively, or save your important dates privately by using my DMs like you're doing right now.

Start by adding birthdays, just let me know their name and full birth date (e.g., `add Sam's birthday on the 11th june 1986`) and I will send congratulatory messages when birthdays are due! ğŸ‰. (on a group chat, add and remove birthdays by using the /add and /remove commands).

Check some other commands you can use by typing /help and please give us your feedback using the /feedback command. Enjoy! ğŸˆ
helpMessage:
ğŸ’¡ Here are some of the commands you can use on a group chat:

 - /add - Adds a new birthday with the name and date separated by a comma (eg, `/add Samuel, 1994-03-21`)
 - /remove - Removes a birthday (eg, `/remove David`)
 - /birthdays - Lists everyone's birthdays, sorted by the nearest date.
 - /ages - Lists everyone, sorted by age.
 - /next - Shows who has the next upcoming birthday!
 - /birthdaybot - Slightly magical command, just tell the bot what you want it to do (eg, `/birthdaybot add Peter on April 15, 1980`).
 - /config - Shows the current configuration for this group. If you are an admin, you can change it by separating the key and value with a comma. (eg, `/config language, en`)
 - /calendar - Opens the Birthday Calendar view.
 - /feedback - Send us your feedback!
helpMessageOnDm:
ğŸ’¡ When using direct messages, you can just tell me what you need me to do, for instance `add Sam's birthday on the 11th june 1986`, or, `remove Peter's birthday` - there's no need to use commands!

If you really want to though, here the commands you can use (you'll definitely need to use them when interacting with me on a group chat!):

 - /add - Adds a new birthday with the name and date separated by a comma (eg, `/add Samuel, 1994-03-21`)
 - /remove - Removes a birthday (eg, `/remove David`)
 - /birthdays - Lists everyone's birthdays, sorted by the nearest date.
 - /ages - Lists everyone, sorted by age.
 - /next - Shows who has the next upcoming birthday!
 - /birthdaybot - Slightly magical command, just tell the bot what you want it to do (eg, `/birthdaybot add Peter on April 15, 1980`).
 - /config - Shows the current configuration for this group. If you are an admin, you can change it by separating the key and value with a comma. (eg, `/config language, en`)
 - /calendar - Opens the Birthday Calendar view.
 - /feedback - Send us your feedback!
configMessage:
Here's this group's configuration:
 \- `language`:  *{{language}}*
 \- `notificationHour`: The earliest the bot will send birthday notifications: *{{notificationHour}}h* \(UTC, 24h format\)
 \- `restrictedToAdmins`: Whether managing birthdays is limited to group administrators: *{{restrictedToAdmins}}*
